document.heading: SCHOOL PROXIMITY TRAFFIC CALMING ACT OF 2000

history.narrative: Law 13-111, the “School Proximity Traffic Calming Act of 2000,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-131, which was referred to the Committee on Public Works and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on January 4, 2000, and February 1, 2000, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on February 18, 2000, it was assigned Act No. 13-175 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-111 became effective on May 23, 2000.
